title: About the Quinn Changes
body:
And we get a word on the range increase that Quinn currently has on the PBE?

I keep getting excited for this same Quinn buff that keeps coming but it keeps being removed.

Is this another mistake? Or is it intended? If it is a mistake are you planning on changing anything on Quinn any time soon?

replies.body: We don't have any current plans to change Quinn in the short term at least. The range change was being tested internally as part of a set of changes that included a number of other things (much shorter ult CD late game, removal of ult damage etc). We'll probably explore some of that stuff again at some point, conclusion was that that wasn't an immediate clear win though and that we wanted to focus on the upcoming pre-season work instead right now.

So she isn't getting a range buff? {{item:3070}} {{item:3151}} {{item:3070}} 
I didn't care for the ult changes, but was getting really excited for the range increase

Id rather have her blind pass through minions instead of stop on the first one it hits, so I can at least have better blinding positioning when I inevitably put myself right in the line of fire by vaulting.  That would be infinitely more useful to me than a tiny range increase.  I just hate how she gets punished so hard for using her passive and her vault, but its such a fun mechanic at the same time.

I don't like how they keep hinting they're gonna nerf her movement speed.  I won't feel any more at ease having a miniscule 25 extra range when I'm all-of-a-sudden easier to catch and have much more difficulty chasing.  Especially when you consider it's straight nerfs to Valor.  You start your ult farther away, you're melee so the extra range doesn't benefit you, rather without Vault it just hinders you and now you're slower to boot.

I'm not sure where this misguided and illogical philosophy of transferring power newly came from, but why is it that only underpowered champions that need pure unadulterated buffs are victimized into being the labrats for it?  It hasn't worked once yet, it just keeps making champions weaker every time Riot tries it.  There's a word for repeating the exact same action over and over expecting different results...
If it did that, you wouldn't be able to use to attack minions are anything. Might as well make it a point-and-click blind, but that would definitely be bad for the game
shyvana's still hits minions as it passes through them

The waveclear on her Q is WAY too good to trade for a little more harassment potential when she's already got buckets of that. She needs it to hit minions.

Also, riot would never do that as it removes her counterplay options.

I wasn't implying that it shouldn't damage the minions.  Shyvana's passes through but still damages them. There's plenty of ways to work it, if she's going to announce to the world that she's going in with her harrier passive then she needs to be able to reliably blind them so that she can outplay them on the trade.   its blatantly obvious

Any chance we can get her autoattack to be tightened up to be more responsive? I think she's good but her AA is extremely sluggish I find. For example it's very easy for the enemy to walk away right after Quinn uses Vault because the follow up AA animation takes too long (before AS that is).

Can we please just NEVER take Quinn's Blind away? Can we also NEVER change Quinn's ult? These key moves are what makes Quinn viable as a champion in league of legends and the new "changes" that I've heard about are really going  to have a negative effect on her. If there have to be changes made they should be made to her w. The w should be able to be used as a valor scout that provides vision like ashe's vision shot. The rest should be left alone PLEASE!!!

This is good. The short CD but no skystrike really hurt her core gameplay as an assassin and seemed to be trying to bring her in line with other ADCs.

If anything, if she's ever changed it should be in a way that improves her power as a duelist/assassin in exchange for ADC viability.

The one Quinn change I would absolutely love, and I suspect has never been suggested, is making Flash+Vault like.. not utterly awkward. So many champions can make clean flash+gapcloser plays in this game(think Talon). With Quinn, if you've ever tried this, I think it's maybe even buggy? It feels like the Flash confuses the vault and sends quinn much farther than she should be? I'm no expert, but it's almost IMPOSSIBLE to land the passive proc after flash vaulting someone.

So then the fact that it's currently up on the PBE is unintentional... okay.

We'll hope to what lies ahead I guess.

So, the range/MS changes going on/off with the preseason changes isn't intended, but more of a bug...good. I never particularily liked them as a standalone change.

Thanks for finally answering this, Meddler :)

I'd honestly rather they don't change her if it's not for the better.

I'm getting so used to playing her now that if they change her drastically (removing her ult damage) I might not want to play her at all... It's a very fine balance.

I've played hundreds of games with Quinn now... she's pretty much all I play. I really wish they would just fix her issues instead of doing these weird stat swaps. Fix her AA so it's not so clunky... Give her better base stats or something... She's hurting pretty bad. I mean BRAUM literally beats her in every base stat... including AD. SERIOUSLY. I almost choked when I saw that Braum out-stats Quinn in every way, short of range.

edit: I realize Braum is meant for support and he has huge cooldowns, etc... But that's besides the point..... Quinn still has some of the worst base stats for an AD.
This is why no1 play her as ADC... Meanwhile, {{champion:51}} range = 650 . {{champion:133}} range = 500. Such gap
it's 525. And yeah, playing against a caitlyn as quinn sucks, but she bullies pretty much everyone in lane with her range; it's her thing

It's actually not that bad, you're just going to have to avoid going into her range and missing some cs.

Cait's not that good with all ins, so the only way to win the lane match up is just to get in and engage with every opportunity you can find, and win. (An engage support helps in this case)

Eventually you'll make the cait scared from approaching either you or your support, so there will be less poke. Early game, stay away from cait, dodge those q's, poke q's back and e, aa. And pray that this cait isn't that aggressive as poking early game. If you fail on your first engage, try again, but if you start feeding, then try to dominate late game.

I get BT later on, so I become poke immune. Of course this doesn't work with everyone, but I just prefer BT because I like burst damage with passive. (The REQR instakill combo is so satisfying...)

On the bottom post, Braum and Leona are so good supports with Quinn :D Any champ with some sort of stun and gap closer works perfectly fine. (Including pantheon, rammus, poppy, thresh)

Actually you can totally crush a Caitlyn as Quinn if you have a good all-in support and play that lane right. The key is that you have to play **extremely** aggressively from the very beginning (recommend Long Sword+3 health pot start), any time Caitlyn dares to try and harass, go ham on her, Caitlyn loses all-ins to almost every other ADC early game so she will almost assuredly try and disengage (usually w/ E one she has a few levels). You should be able to disengage quite easily having won the trade pretty hard, just be sure not to continue to pursuing if it would result in overcommitting.

Best supports for this imo are Jarvan IV and Leona. I've been the J4 in ranked before w/ a Quinn against a Caitlyn+Zyra lane and we crushed them hard, also played w/ Leona as Quinn many times, and its usually VERY effective.

it's true. don't know why the down votes lol.
just have to be careful not eating too much harass level 1-3, then you can go somewhat ham on caitlyn.
E briefly disables your target and you get your passive proc
now you won the trade and run off with W passive's bonus movement speed.

braum works quite well, you will start the aggression with E and braum use stand behind me.
or janna shield you just as you vault back and get bonus AD on passive proc.
with both supports you can make sure you don't receive damage from counterattack
and allow you to play aggressively but stil be very safe.

I'd just wait and see the full set of changes Riot makes to her, then watch as it makes her even worse, wait about a year when a good designer picks her up, makes her op and then she has her numbers nerfed to uselesness. I've been here for over 3 years, seen it a million times. Except with Rengar, he is their special kitty.

I feel like these changes to the ult are making it completely useless, your making it a cast time sivir ult for one person with some damage at the end.  I think you should still be able to auto at least.
Why did you just bump a year old thread?

But the most important question:
Can Quinn still jungle?{{champion:133}} {{summoner:11}} {{item:3154}}
Yes she can, she has to build burst bruiser for it
I'd think she'd get outshone in that case.  She was the ONLY marksman jungle this season, so I was just wondering if that niche still exists for her.

Sure Cait can beat Quinn at early game trades... but by mid game, Cait isn't even on Quinn's radar anymore... Quinn can delete Caitlyn by mid-game without even losing HP.

All you have to do as Quinn vs Caitlyn early game is to keep up in farm... You can literally lose tower and still destroy Caitlyn for the rest of the game.

9 times out of 10, the enemy ADC will start wandering around solo after laning phase, and that's easy pickings for Quinn and Valor.
